abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project rating is
            satisfactory, sustainability is likely, and the
            institutional development impact is substantial. Lessons
            drawn from the project spell out that, prior to any
            technical assistance agreement, the implementing
            agency's capacity should be confirmed, to be able to
            provide for required training, if any. Free standing
            technical assistance components (not those supporting
            project preparation), should focus on the agreed overall
            objectives, within the context of the Country Assistance
            Strategy. Furthermore, the soundness of proposed technical
            assistance components, should be assessed prior to project
            inclusion, thus ensuring quality at entry, and, project
            design should incorporate flexibility, allowing for the
            necessary adjustments in technical assistance components, or
            for modifications by executing agencies, on its contents,
            without altering objectives. Project coordination,
            particularly with subprojects under different task managers,
            should be firmly agreed prior to project, and subprojects approval.

18155439.theme: International financial standards and systems,Economic statistics, modeling and forecasting
18155439.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Economic management

abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the project is
            to provide the Government of Bangladesh (GOB) with
            continuing, flexible funding for the preparation of
            investment projects in general, and more specifically, for
            that part related to IDA's lending program. Secondly,
            the project will provide support to GOB in strengthening key
            agencies responsible for implementation of investment
            projects. Thirdly, the project would contribute to the
            attainment of a sound investment program through financing
            of training and the undertaking of related technical
            assistance activities identified by GOB. The project will
            finance technical assistance for (a) project preparation,
            (b) implementation support for IDA-financed investment
            projects, (c) institutional strengthening, (d) studies, and
            (e) other technical assistance activities related to
            IDA's program in Bangladesh. As was the case with
            previous IDA financed technical assistance projects in
            Bangladesh, approximately one half of the technical
            assistance subprojects will be for project preparation, one
            third for institutional development, and the rest for other
            types of technical assistance.
